page.title: 13Housing.
page.content: The S.W. end of West Ashton vill- age falls in our 3x4 block. Most of the housing in this section is concen- rated 'in-fill' that has taken place in the last 10 years. The houses are individually designed, executive type, built in brick or reconstituted stone. Interspersed are a few pre 2nd W.War dwellings and the original farm houses which are approx 200yrs old. At the end of the village is a group of 4 s/d council houses.Another group of 8 s/d council houses built in 1952/3 is just along the East Town Rd. Other housing in the area is confined to the hamlets of East Town and Dunge, a few individual houses a- long Capps Lane, and the isolated farm houses. Some of the farmhouses are be- tween 200-300 yrs old and are fine buildings, due to be listed in the near future.
